unnormalised: ## My Weekend Grocery Haul - A Tale of Kilos, Liters, and Rupees
normalised: My Weekend Grocery Haul - A Tale of Kilograms, Liters, and Rupees

unnormalised: So, the weekend rolled around, and as usual, it was time for the dreaded grocery run. Living alone in Mumbai means I have to be super organised, especially with the whole work-from-home situation still ongoing. I decided to hit the local farmer's market this time, hoping for fresher produce and maybe a slightly better deal than the reliance fresh nearby.
normalised: So, the weekend rolled around, and as usual, it was time for the dreaded grocery run. Living alone in Mumbai means I have to be super organized, especially with the whole work-from-home situation still ongoing. I decided to hit the local farmer's market this time, hoping for fresher produce and maybe a slightly better deal than the Reliance Fresh nearby.

unnormalised: First stop, the veggies. I needed potatoes – at least 2 kg for the week. I usually end up making aloo parathas or some sort of sabzi. The vendor quoted me Rs. 30 per kg, which seemed reasonable enough. Then came the onions. Red onions are a must in every Indian household, right? I grabbed about 1.5 kg of those, costing me Rs. 40/kg.
normalised: First stop, the veggies. I needed potatoes – at least two kilograms for the week. I usually end up making aloo parathas or some sort of sabzi. The vendor quoted me rupee thirty per kilogram, which seemed reasonable enough. Then came the onions. Red onions are a must in every Indian household, right? I grabbed about one point five kilograms of those, costing me rupee forty per kilogram.

unnormalised: Next, I ventured into the leafy greens section. Spinach is a staple, and I got a big bunch weighing around 500 grams. The vendor tried to overcharge me, quoting Rs. 60, but I haggled him down to Rs. 50. It's all about the negotiation, you know! Coriander, the ultimate garnish, was next. Just a small bunch, maybe 100 grams, costing Rs. 10.
normalised: Next, I ventured into the leafy greens section. Spinach is a staple, and I got a big bunch weighing around five hundred grams. The vendor tried to overcharge me, quoting rupee sixty, but I haggled him down to rupee fifty. It's all about the negotiation, you know! Coriander, the ultimate garnish, was next. Just a small bunch, maybe one hundred grams, costing rupee ten.

unnormalised: Moving on from the veggies, I needed to stock up on some lentils. Moong dal, chana dal, and toor dal are the basics. I bought 1 kg of each, averaging about Rs. 120 per kg. Then, I noticed a stall selling organic rice. A 5 kg bag of basmati rice was priced at Rs. 400. I had to get it!
normalised: Moving on from the veggies, I needed to stock up on some lentils. Moong dal, chana dal, and toor dal are the basics. I bought one kilogram of each, averaging about rupee one hundred and twenty per kilogram. Then, I noticed a stall selling organic rice. A five kilogram bag of basmati rice was priced at rupee four hundred. I had to get it!

unnormalised: Of course, no grocery trip is complete without oil. I usually buy a 5-liter can of sunflower oil. This time, it cost me Rs. 750. I also picked up a 1-liter bottle of milk (Rs. 60) and a packet of sugar (1 kg for Rs. 50).
normalised: Of course, no grocery trip is complete without oil. I usually buy a five-liter can of sunflower oil. This time, it cost me rupee seven hundred and fifty. I also picked up a one-liter bottle of milk (rupee sixty) and a packet of sugar (one kilogram for rupee fifty).

unnormalised: As I made my way to the dairy section, I saw some fantastic mangoes! It's the season, after all. A dozen alphonso mangoes were going for Rs. 800. A bit steep, but I couldn't resist. A little treat for myself!
normalised: As I made my way to the dairy section, I saw some fantastic mangoes! It's the season, after all. A dozen alphonso mangoes were going for rupee eight hundred. A bit steep, but I couldn't resist. A little treat for myself!

unnormalised: Finally, I packed everything into my reusable bags, feeling a sense of accomplishment. The total damage? Around Rs. 3500. A bit more than I expected, but hey, fresh produce and delicious mangoes are worth it, right? Now, time to prep everything for the week ahead.
normalised: Finally, I packed everything into my reusable bags, feeling a sense of accomplishment. The total damage? Around rupee three thousand five hundred. A bit more than I expected, but hey, fresh produce and delicious mangoes are worth it, right? Now, time to prep everything for the week ahead.
